document_title: Acute gastritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
1. How long does acute gastritis last?
The duration of acute gastritis depends on the cause of the disease, the time of initiation of treatment and the therapy. Usually, symptoms will show signs of improvement within a few days to a few weeks if the condition has not progressed to a serious level.(4)
2. What should you eat if you have acute gastritis?
Fiber-rich food group: whole grains, fruits, vegetables, beans...; Low-fat food group: Vegetables, lean meat, fish...; Food groups with low acidity: Vegetables, beans.; The drink does not contain gas, caffeine, or alcohol; Food groups containing Probiotics that are beneficial for health: kimchi, yogurt, kombucha...
3. Is acute gastritis contagious?
Acute gastritis is infectious if the cause is Helicobacter Pylori bacteria. Common ways of transmission include:
Swimming in rivers, streams, swimming pools; Eating uncooked foods; The family has a relative who is sick and lives together.
Contact with an infected person's saliva has not yet been proven to be a route of transmission. However, in all cases, self-protection is still necessary.
